creator: nicholas.holshouser@sap.com
text:
For a URL such as http://host/program.cgi?hello=world (or any URL with query 
string and arguments, mod_cache will not cache the content without an expires 
header. According to the RFC 2616/13.9, for HTTP/1.1 the presence of Cache-
Control headers only is sufficient (no expires required).

Here's the change I used -
else if (r->args && exps == NULL && cc_out == NULL) {
        /* if query string present but no expiration time, don't cache it
         * also should check HTTP/1.1 response for presence of Cache-Control
         * RFC makes exception for 1.1 compliant servers
         * (RFC 2616/13.9)
         */
        reason = "Query string present but no expires header or Cache-Control";
    }

adding a check for cache-control prior to making response non-cacheable

thanks,

Nick Holshouser
Can you test this again in 2.0.54?
